body.p: Wheras about the 15th Sept 1861 one John Gallegher Hapened to get Drunk and made some noise in the Town of Germantown and was Taken up and fined by a justice to the Extent of the Law for Drunkeness also fined by a jury of the Country $15" for Disturbing the peace it being the first time anything of the Kind ever Hapened here and the family is Quite poore and have a Large family dependent upon the old man for a suport.

Now we the undersigned petitioners would respectfully Solicit the Interposition of your Honors magisty and respectfully ask you to remitt the fine of $15. as we think it is one of the cases that comes justly in the catilogue thers has bin more agrivated cases committed in our midst and no notice Taken of them we make the above request of your Honor because we Know it to be one of the cases that ought to be excused by you if there ever was one from the fact of there being Nine or Ten children in the Famly all Dependent upon the old man for a suport. your petitioners again respectfully ask your Honor to remitt the above fine believing that the small fine which he will pay and the cost is s great a burden as he can bare. We submitt the matter to your Honor believing you will do what is right in the matter, this 1st Oct 1861
